Reasoning: **Analysis and Decision-Making for the Shop Phase**

Okay, here's the situation: Ante 6, Round 12. $33 in the bank. I've got a solid Joker lineup: Odd Todd for chips, Abstract Joker for mult, To the Moon for interest, Gift Card for sell value (and an extra Joker slot, which is important here), The Tribe for Flush multiplier, and Acrobat for the end-hand multiplier. I'm rocking a Flush build, currently level 5.

I need to make the most of this shop phase. I have one Jupiter in my inventory, thanks to the 6 of Spades effect, and I need to level up my flush!

First, let's confirm the Joker slot situation. With the Gift Card (Negative), I should have one slot free given the max is six jokers. Seems good.

Looking at the shop, the Walkie Talkie isn't ideal for this Flush-focused strategy. Riff-Raff *could* be interesting to get sell value from Gift Card, but it's a bit slow, so I'll put it aside for now. Celestial Packs are interesting given I have the Telescope voucher! And the Hone Voucher could be a solid investment for late game scaling.

My initial plan is clear: **Use the Jupiter consumable to level up the Flush**.

The current plan is to use Jupiter immediately to level up the Flush and then buy the Celestial Packs. This approach seems the most efficient given that I have the Telescope Voucher guaranteeing Planet card in my packs. I think, since the Jupiter is already in my inventory, I can use it without buying anything first.

# Available Commands
The possible commands in Balatro are all composed of a single word specifying the action, followed by any necessary positional arguments, which are lists of integers.
Note: all position arguments are 1-indexed.

The following commands are available in your current game state.
use_consumable <consumeable_position> <target_card_position1> <target_card_position2> ... <target_card_positionN> - Use a consumeable from the consumeables section. The first position argument is the position within your consumables inventory of the consumable you'd like to use. Subsequent position arguments specify the cards in hand that the consumeable will be used on, if that consumeable requires targets.
sell_consumable <consumeable_position> - Sell a consumeable from the consumeables section.
rearrange_jokers <joker1> <joker2> ... <jokerN> - Rearrange the list of currently owned jokers. Every index in the list of current jokers must be present, i.e. if there are 5 jokers, the indices 1-5 must be present.
sell_joker <joker_position> - Sell a joker from the jokers section.
buy_card <card_position> - Buy a card from the card section. Individual Joker cards are also bought from the card section.
buy_booster <booster_pack_position> - Buy a booster pack from the booster pack section.
buy_voucher <voucher_position> - Buy a voucher from the voucher section.
buy_and_use_consumable <consumable_position> - Buy a consumable type card (Tarot, Planet, Spectral) from the card section and use it immediately. Cannot do this if the consumable requires target hand cards.
round_select - Finish shopping and go to the round select screen.
reroll_shop - Spends the reroll cost to reroll the cards section of the shop.

Analyze the total game state and context above, and respond with the appropriate action to take next."}

Let's check the money after this: $27 - $4 = $23. Then if I bought Hone, it would be $23 - $10 = $13. To the Moon will give me about $4 interest ($2 per $5).

Okay, so Celestial Pack is a must. The Celestial Pack is the priority. With Telescope, it will be optimized to give me a flush card.

Before executing, let's quickly re-evaluate the shop cards. Walkie Talkie and Riff-raff. Riff-raff is useless since I have 6/6 Jokers already. Walkie Talkie is also not helpful because my core build doesn't focus on 10s or 4s. So, scratch those.
